qas.question: What company annexed large areas of India in the 18th and 19th centuries?
What effect did Company rule in India produce in 1857?
After the Rebellion who administered the British provinces of India?
The rapid development of what did British rule cause in India?
What party was the leader in the Indian independence movement of the 20th century?

context: From the late 18th century to the mid-19th century, large areas of India were annexed by the <a0_0>British East India Company<a0_0/> of British Empire. Dissatisfaction with Company rule led to the <a1_0>Indian Rebellion<a1_0/> of 1857, after which the British provinces of India were directly administered by the <a2_0>British Crown<a2_0/> and witnessed a period of both rapid development of <a3_0>infrastructure<a3_0/> and economic stagnation. During the first half of the 20th century, a nationwide struggle for independence was launched with the leading party involved being the <a4_0>Indian National Congress<a4_0/> which was later joined by other organizations. The subcontinent gained independence from the United Kingdom in 1947, after the British provinces were partitioned into the dominions of India and Pakistan and the princely states all acceded to one of the new states.
